Descriptions_WS_WA: Big crop, ripe and complex; a star early on, only to be eclipsed by others this decade
Fine growing season led to uniformly rich, fleshy, supple and balanced wines
Just off the pace, with well-balanced, supple wines; a few stars
A showy year all around; ripe, complex and fleshy, with excellent depth
Surprisingly fine year, with wines marked by great flavors, balance and structure
A sleeper, with a remarkable number of compelling wines; warm year with fine concentration and depth
Huge crop of ripe, opulent, fleshy, concentrated wines, from near-perfect weather; super in Sonoma, too
Cool, damp year with mostly green, herbal wines marked by gritty tannins; few memorable bottles
Tremendous depth, concentration and structure from a cool, moderate year; ageworthy
Mixed and a bit green overall, but some stellar wines that may be overlooked and undervalued
Excellent weather; many stunning wines but also a few disappointments
Superb in Napa; dense and rich, rivaling 2001 for depth and complexity
Uneven ripeness; austere and tannic in style. More like 2000 than 2001 or 2002
Small crop of exceptional quality; ripe, elegant, concentrated and harmonious
Record-size crop; best are elegant and balanced, yet many are tannic and drying out
A late, cool harvest produced dense, concentrated and ageworthy wines
Textbook year; small crop, ideal ripening, wines defined by complexity and plush tannins
Frost year lowered yields but not quality; unique for its depth and concentration
Late, cool year yielding a surprise bounty of pure, opulent wines
Cool, steady year; wines show exceptional quality, tight, dense and layered
Rare rainy harvest proved it can happen; few sunny spots, variable quality

The first of California’s drought-influenced run and a welcome return to warm, dry conditions following the rain-marred 2011 season. Record-sized crop with many stars; a solid vintage across the board marked by a tannic spine that will age well

Practically a flawless growing season, with moderate temperatures throughout and no heat spikes or rain. Earliest harvest in 25 years started in August, but Indian summer conditions allowed growers to pick blocks as they wanted through late October. Wines brim with fruit and structure. A no-brainer benchmark

Heavy rains in February and March gave the vines an early boost—though not enough to break the drought—and from there warm, dry conditions led to an early harvest. Quality is very consistent, with the wines showing power and depth, as well as extra aromatic range. A beautiful vintage with a distinct signature

The fourth drought-influenced year in a row, plus a cold spell during flowering led to significantly lower yields. The smaller crop ripened quickly, though, with picking beginning in August. Quality is high but more variable than 2016 or 2013, as sugars sometimes raced ahead of phenolics

The final drought-influenced vintage of the run since 2012, this time without serious heat spikes. Rockier soils and drier spots ripened first, while heavier soils allowed for longer hang time. Wines show intense fruit against the backdrop of their varying terroirs; crop still down from normal

Drought broke over the winter, with lots of vegetation and healthy vines to start the season. Good growing season turned wickedly hot in early September, with no cooling-off period, then wildfires raged in early October, raising the specter of smoke taint. Napa’s most difficult season in recent memory
Rivals '97 in opulence and concentration; great finesse
Monumental year; very ripe, opulent and complex
Lean and austere statewide; highly variable
Sonoma and Santa Barbara are tops, with rich, complex wines
Carneros the clear star; wines elsewhere lack depth and completeness
Best in Carneros and Sonoma; concentrated, with firm acidity
Sensational, fleshy, opulent wines; near perfect in Sonoma, strong in Carneros and Napa
Leaner, crisper wines than in '02 due to a challenging season, but some gems, too
Sonoma stars in a ripe, rich, opulent year that rivals 2002
Restrained wines; trim and tight, with higher acidity
Challenging harvest with mixed quality and fewer gems, but hardly a washout
Ripe, complex, balanced and ageworthy wines; many brilliant bottles from all appellations
Frost and fire didn't spoil the vintage, though quality is variable. Tight, concentrated wines
Cooler year showing toned-down ripeness, with more finesse and delicacy
Cool year resulted in uneven quality; best wines are tight and concentrated
Cool and damp, challenging everywhere; best wines are elegant and scaled back
Ideal growing season; wines are intense, with pure, ripe, vibrant flavors
An exceptional year, distinct for vibrancy and density; ageworthy
Drought produced spartan crop; fine quality, with yields the only disappointment
Sonoma strong again in another drought year; elegant and refined in style
Solid but variable year; fine quality in Sonoma and Santa Barbara
Ample winter rain followed by a warm growing season yielded complex and powerful wines
Nearly ideal conditions delivered wines with concentrated fruit flavors and crunchy acidity
Best overall for Napa, with rich, structured wines
Ripe, opulent and supple wines
Marked by lean, hollow wines
One of the best for Napa; ordinary for Sonoma
Mixed in both regions
Good, but not on par with '01 Cabernet
About as good as it gets in Napa, with Sonoma lagging
Tight and tannic wines; best to decant
The best are supple, rich and complex; a step above the 2003s
Top wines are elegant and well-focused, with ripeness achieved at lower alcohol levels
Inconsistent; best are rich and supple, but many are lean and herbal
Supple and appealing wines from Napa; Sonoma offers value
Top producers made superior wines while others struggled in a cool year
Ideal season; best wines show balance, structure and lively acidity
Extremely cool season; many wines are herbal and have unripe tannins
Rainy and cool year; many wines have hard tannins, herbal flavors
Long, warm growing season produced rich, ripe and easy-drinking wines
Sunny weather and a long growing season led to fruit-forward wines
Drought-influenced vintage yields well-structured wines with refined fruit flavors
Small crop from another drought vintage; firmly tannic, with deep dark fruit and spice flavors
Nearly ideal weather results in plush flavors and structures supported by medium-grained tannins
